intro: Peplis erecta var. hispidula, commonly known as the hairy peplis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and hairy foliage, which gives it its specific epithet "hispidula." The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in loose inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in arid and semi-arid environments.
